page.title: 05Farming around Hordley
page.content: Most farmers keep Friesian cattle and cross their heifers with beef breeds such as Herefords but other calves are pure Friesian. Where farmers keep beef cattle they normally sell them when they reach 480-500Kg., mostly at Oswestry market.Milk goes to Ellesmere dairy by bulk tanker. Over half of the land is grass with some for silage,some for strip grazing and some is more extensive. Some crops such as barley are mostly for feed but cash crops such as rape, potatoes and sugar beet are grown. An interesting experiment has been the small scale growing of maize but, so far, not very successfully. Mechanisation has increased greatly, resulting in fewer farm workers. Small farmers harvest grain and beet using local specialist farm contractors,thus avoiding the purchase of costly plant.
